summary.p: To manipulate matrix values, use the .NET or C++ float3x2 types instead.

remarks.p: When targeting the Windows universal app platform, this struct is moved to the namespace Windows.Foundation.Numerics.

This Windows Runtime type is only used for data exchange, and does not include any methods for manipulating the values or performing math computations. For more complete functionality, see the .NET and C++ Windows.Foundation.Numerics namespaces.

System.Numerics.Matrix3x2 and Windows.Foundation.Numerics.float3x2 provide implicit conversion operators to and from Microsoft.Graphics.Canvas.Numerics.Matrix3x2, so you can use these richer types in your application code, then pass them directly to Windows Runtime APIs that consume the Microsoft.Graphics.Canvas.Numerics types.
